page.title: 05MORE OF THE CHURCH AT WILLEY
page.content: In the Victorian times the vicar Rev. Morgan Palor helped build a new vestry & chancel,a stained glass East window is dedicated to his memory.A new font, pulpit & lecturn were installed it is recorded that several Bishops attended the reconsecration of this small church.Church life has changed,now the vicar is shared with Churchover parish with one family communion service a fortnight in Willey,attended by a congregation of about fourteen. The Mayor of Rugby comes to the Harvest Festival service, a special occasion. A CUSTOM continued at Baptisms today is leaving a small door open in the South wall of the Chancel to allow the devil to escape. Grooves on the outer walls, were probably made by scythes being sharpened a CUSTOM said to bring a good harvest.
